repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: when diagnostic have a range of line, open_float not work.

Solution: filter diagnsotic by a line number range.


Fix #21949

comment_data.body: The fix looks right, but I'm not sure I follow what this test is doing? For one thing, I don't see any multi-line diagnostics. Why is the test result expecting 2 elements in `winids`? Can you either rewrite the test to be a little clearer, or at least add some clarifying comments to help understand the flow of the test?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2444,6 +2444,36 @@ describe('vim.diagnostic', function()
       ]]
       )
     end)
+
+    it('works for multi-line diagnostics', function()
+      local result = exec_lua [[
+        local diagnostics = {
+          make_error("Syntax error", 0, 1, 1, 3),
+        }
+        local winids = {}
+        vim.api.nvim_win_set_buf(0, diagnostic_bufnr)
+        vim.diagnostic.set(diagnostic_ns, diagnostic_bufnr, diagnostics)
+        local _, w1 = vim.diagnostic.open_float(0, { header = false })
+        if w1 then
+          table.insert(winids, w1)
+          vim.api.nvim_win_close(w1, true)
+        end
+        vim.api.nvim_win_set_cursor(0, {2, 0})
+        local _, w2 = vim.diagnostic.open_float(0, { header = false })
+        if w2 then
+          table.insert(winids, w2)
+          vim.api.nvim_win_close(w2, true)
+        end
+        vim.api.nvim_win_set_cursor(0, {3, 0})
+        local _, w3 = vim.diagnostic.open_float(0, { header = false })
+        if w3 then
+          table.insert(winids, w3)
+          vim.api.nvim_win_close(w3, true)
+        end
+        return #winids
+      ]]
+      eq(2, result)
+    end)

comment_data.body: make_error the line is 0 row and 1 row mean line 1 and line 2. put cursor in line 1 has w1 in line 2 has w2 in line 3 nothing happen.

comment_data.body: Thanks for clarifying, I still think this test is needlessly obscure though. What does the result being `2` mean? You can use `exec_lua` and `eq` more than once in a single test, perhaps break the large `exec_lua` up into smaller bits, each of which returns a specific result (so it's clear exactly what's being tested).

@@ -2444,6 +2444,36 @@ describe('vim.diagnostic', function()
       ]]
       )
     end)
+
+    it('works for multi-line diagnostics', function()

+        vim.api.nvim_win_set_buf(0, diagnostic_bufnr)

+        if w2 then

       ]]

     end)
+
+    it('works for multi-line diagnostics', function()
+      local result = exec_lua [[
+        local diagnostics = {
+          make_error("Syntax error", 0, 1, 1, 3),
+        }
+        local winids = {}
+        vim.api.nvim_win_set_buf(0, diagnostic_bufnr)
+        vim.diagnostic.set(diagnostic_ns, diagnostic_bufnr, diagnostics)
+        local _, w1 = vim.diagnostic.open_float(0, { header = false })
+        if w1 then
+          table.insert(winids, w1)
+          vim.api.nvim_win_close(w1, true)
+        end
+        vim.api.nvim_win_set_cursor(0, {2, 0})
+        local _, w2 = vim.diagnostic.open_float(0, { header = false })
+        if w2 then
+          table.insert(winids, w2)
+          vim.api.nvim_win_close(w2, true)
+        end
+        vim.api.nvim_win_set_cursor(0, {3, 0})
+        local _, w3 = vim.diagnostic.open_float(0, { header = false })
+        if w3 then
+          table.insert(winids, w3)

+      ]]
+      eq(2, result)
+    end)

@@ -2444,6 +2444,47 @@ describe('vim.diagnostic', function()
       ]]
       )
     end)
+
+    it('works for multi-line diagnostics #21949', function()
+      -- open float failed non diagnostic lnum
+      eq(
+        vim.NIL,
+        exec_lua [[
+        local diagnostics = {
+          make_error("Error in two lines lnum is 1 and end_lnum is 2", 1, 1, 2, 3),
+        }
+        local winids = {}
+        vim.api.nvim_win_set_buf(0, diagnostic_bufnr)
+        vim.diagnostic.set(diagnostic_ns, diagnostic_bufnr, diagnostics)
+        local _, winnr = vim.diagnostic.open_float(0, { header = false })
+        return winnr
+      ]]
+      )
+
+      -- can open a float window on lnum 1
+      eq(
+        { '1. Error in two lines lnum is 1 and end_lnum is 2' },
+        exec_lua [[
+        vim.api.nvim_win_set_cursor(0, {2, 0})
+        local float_bufnr, winnr = vim.diagnostic.open_float(0, { header = false })
+        local lines = vim.api.nvim_buf_get_lines(float_bufnr, 0, -1, false)
+        vim.api.nvim_win_close(winnr, true)
+        return lines
+      ]]
+      )
+
+      -- can open a float window on end_lnum 2
+      eq(
+        { '1. Error in two lines lnum is 1 and end_lnum is 2' },
+        exec_lua [[
+        vim.api.nvim_win_set_cursor(0, {3, 0})
+        local float_bufnr, winnr = vim.diagnostic.open_float(0, { header = false })
+        local lines = vim.api.nvim_buf_get_lines(float_bufnr, 0, -1, false)
+        vim.api.nvim_win_close(winnr, true)
+        return lines
+      ]]
+      )
+    end)

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix(diagnostic): open_float show on multi-line diagnostics
